data.title: Assembly Issue?
data.body:
I received the error below when I took my local git repo and put it into the mod directory inside the game. What is causing this? It's coming from the mod chooser, but I have not changed anything there. The mod was also working just fine until after I overwrote the information.

Reinstalling OpenRA temporarily solved it, but it came back.

Mod Chooser Mod at Version release-20140722
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18444
Exception of type `System.NotSupportedException`: An attempt was made to load an assembly from a network location which would have caused the assembly to be sandboxed in previous versions of the .NET Framework. This release of the .NET Framework does not enable CAS policy by default, so this load may be dangerous. If this load is not intended to sandbox the assembly, please enable the loadFromRemoteSources switch. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=155569 for more information.
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly.nLoadFile(String path, Evidence evidence)
   at System.Reflection.Assembly.LoadFile(String path)
   at OpenRA.ObjectCreator..ctor(Manifest manifest)
   at OpenRA.ModData..ctor(String mod)
   at OpenRA.Game.InitializeMod(String mod, Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Widgets.Logic.ModBrowserLogic.<LoadMod>c__AnonStorey172.<>m__458()
   at System.Action.Invoke()
   at OpenRA.Primitives.ActionQueue.PerformActions()
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

data.title: Avoid reading CenterPosition of invalid targets in DamageWarhead
data.body: Fixes #6642

data.title: Add a proximity upgrade source, and TS stealth generator
data.body:
This introduces a proximity upgrade source and implements the stealth generator as a demonstration of its capabilities.  This will also be useful for area buffs (like the propaganda tower in C&C generals) or debuffs (see [gapgen-sight](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/commits/gapgen-sight) for a prototype of the gap generator sight restriction).

~~The way that our production code is set up means that the proximity bonus won't be granted until the newly produced actor's second tick in the world, which means that units produced in the stealth field will be visible for their first tick.  This will probably require some reworking of the production code to fix.~~

data.title: Adds vqa playback to the asset browser
data.body: Currently the shellmap isn't paused when a video is playing but I'm not sure who to fix that right now.

Found while testing some (unrelated) changes I was making to GDI04a.  Seems to be easily reproducible by selecting all the starting forces and ordering them to the (shrouded) nod base.

data.title: Do not pass nonexisting requested Files!
data.body: I tried to create a new Testmap for TS by Converting a CNC-TD map and started the MapEditor which crashed because the RedAlert Mod worse not Installed GobleFileSystem passed a FileName over the "File-Exist" test which worse returning True but the Stream worse null... The File  does not exist in the Contents Mod Folder (redalert.mix)

data.title: Moves Console and some effects to Mods.Common
data.body: Based off #6632.

data.title: When an infantry unit transforms the other infantry unit appears in the middle of the cell
data.body: I've got a sniper that deploys into a prone sniper, if he's not in the center of the cell when he deploys into his prone unit, the prone version will appear in the center of the cell, same with transforming back, so I assume there's nothing to tell where a transforming unit is within a cell, but I know it's in there as I've seen commands concerning pinpoint cell location in the lua files.

data.title: Tiberian Sun .vqa support
data.body:
Ref : #3363,#3226

This is very much WIP so it is even messier than usual.

Progress so far is:
Most videos load and play without crashing, but the audio is somewhere between stretched out and complete noise. The video only displays some shapes correctly (the spinning EVA logo is the easiest to see), but all colors are wrong and the image is flipped https://imgur.com/NG1yvFc.jpg ([Original video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xuNN9ACgTFg)).
So still left to do is:
- [x] Fix image orientation
- [x] Fix colors
- [x] Fix audio playback
- [x] Performance improvements (Some videos have ~1 sec stutters) 
- [x] Fix crashes with certain videos (I'm not sure if diskdest.vqa is a proper video anyway)

The changes to gitignore and to the asset browser are just for testing so they can be removed once this is complete.

Also credit for reverse engineering goes to [olafvdspek's XCC Mixer](https://code.google.com/p/xcc/).

data.title: Infantry can't leave pillboxes set by lua
data.body:
`Actor.Create("pbox", true, { Owner = player, Location = xyPoint.Location })`
will spawn a pillbox with one rifleman in it,
but you can not tell him to get out.
![pillboxbug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/4477700/ccfbcd10-497f-11e4-875e-596d12621950.png)

Noticeable on monster-tank-madness.

data.title: Mods.Common Widgets
data.body: Moved over Widgets that don't require a bunch of things to move.

data.title: Add SplitFacings option to various Render traits
data.body:
The SplitFacings functionality of WithMuzzleFlash would be very useful on 
- RenderUnit 
- RenderInfantry 
- WithTurret 
- WithBarrel

Advantages:
- per-facing sequence Offsets, ZOffsets, Lengths, Tick rates and so on
- possibility of per-facing SHPs rather than a single monolithic SHP*

*would save me a TON (talking about weeks rather than days) of work on a high-profile project I'm working on

data.title: Make Production / Charge speed depending on health
data.body:
Its quite on that Low Power can reduce Build Speed we can or make additionaly (or replace them) depending on the Health aof a Facetory. I throw this Idea in the IRC...

So a ConYard / Barrakcs / WarFactory and Missle Silo etc 
will depending in health: 
- in Green state will Produce @ 100%
- in Yellow State will Produce @ 50%
- in Red State  will Produce @ 25%

data.title: Reduce production speed of damaged factories
data.body:
```
09:45 < LipkeGu> pchote: we could "change" production speed to the health of a 
                 factory :)
09:45 < LipkeGu> building
09:45 <+pchote> that would be pretty easy in TD
09:45 <+pchote> RA is a bit tricker, since the queues aren't associated with 
                buildings
09:45 <+pchote> I actually quite like that idea
09:45 <+antares79> I'm sure that would screw with the balance pretty badly
09:46 <+antares79> and would invite early rushes
09:46 <+pchote> antares79: it's not significantly different than rushing their 
                power
09:46 <+pchote> which takes production down by a factor of 2-3(?)
09:47 <+antares79> you've got a point there
09:48 < LipkeGu> but it is typicaly that a factory when damaged not can operate 
                 on full time..
09:48 < LipkeGu> we can make it optionly via an option :/
09:48 <+pchote> LipkeGu: I'd prefer that we had it on all the time
09:48 <+pchote> maybe do it based on damage states rather than health
09:49 <+pchote> so buildings in yellow get a 25% production hit, and buildings 
                in red get 50%
09:49 < LipkeGu> yes :)
09:49 <+pchote> or other appropriately balanced values
```
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/5013433-reduce-production-speed-of-damaged-factories?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: If unit cant attack, it shouldnt move 'face to face' to the target instead
data.body:
If unit cant attack, the default behaviour should be _ignore_ the attack command

this apply for e.g.:
medics
mehanics (vs buildings)
aa's vs land units (mobile s.a.m.)
special units (gap generators, radar jammers, miners...)

its just waste of units if we missed it in group during fight
creating special groups for them is really unhandy

data.title: "gg" as immediate capitulation
data.body:
Not very important, but according to the conventional politeness in video games, such as "gl" for “good luck” or "hf" for “have fun”, "gg" (for “good game”) is used to end a game. It could be another way to capitulate if written in the chat, instead of going in the menu and selecting Surrender.
("gg" : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rQPTPiionxI&t=80m50s)
